720895f-a.text:
(1)
Leroy Street, eastern section (formerly Burton Street), east from and including Seventh Avenue South and Bedford Street. 46 Bedford Street, on the N.E. corner of Leroy Street, is an old frame house faced with brick, which is to be demolished the year after this photograph was taken. 48 Bedford Street, the five-story house adjoining it, had its northwest corner trimmed in 1914 when Seventh Avenue South was cut through and now has a Seventh Avenue South address.
May 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Leroy Street,east of Seventh Avenue. Note that #46 Bedford Street had been demolished and a new building erected.
April 13th,1940
P.L.Sperr,
720895f-a.folder: Leroy Street & 7th Avenue South, Manhattan, NY

709624f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue South, east side, north of Le Roy Street.

March 6, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
709624f-a.folder: 7th Avenue South & Leroy Street, Manhattan, NY

720899f-b.text:
No. 1
68-64 Leroy Street, south side, west of Seventh Avenue South, seen from St. Luke's Place and showing at the right a portion of Hudson Park. 68-66 Leroy Street, the low building adjoining the eastern side of the park, is the Hudson Park Library, a branch of the New York Public Library. The eastern side of the building exactly marks the old eastern boundary of the Trinity Church Farm, which was originally one of the Dutch farms confiscated by the Duke of York, and was deeded in perpetuity to Trinity Church by Queen Anne.
May 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
No. 2
A view solely of the Hudson ark Library during imrovemment by the (orks trogress Administration. This agency also constructed a swimming pool in the easterly portion of the Park that adjoins this structure. During same, several gruesome objects were
recovered, as this was formerly St. Johns Cemetery.
January 19, 1937
Vorks Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
Credit Line Imperative

720896f-a.text:
38, 36, 34, 32 Leroy Street (eastern section), at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Bedford Street, east of and from Seventh Avenue South. 44 Bedford Street, the corner house, and 42 adjoining it,
are shown.
May 19, 1933.
.. Sperr.  P. 1
720896f-a.folder: Leroy Street & Bedford Street, Manhattan, NY

720897f-b.text:
(1)
Leroy Street, eastern section (formerly Burton Street), north side, east from and including Bedford Street and Seventh Avenue South. 46 Bedford Street, the old frame house at the corner, and 29 Leroy Street adjoining it, are to be demolished before 1935.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 361.
(2)
A closer view at a later date.
May 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

720898f-a.text:
Leroy Street, south side, at Bedford Street, as photographed from the west side of Seventh Avenue Extension and across ssme. Thru the center runs Bedford Street to continue its southeasterly
course to Sixth Avenue at Houston Street.
May 7, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
